section.title: Tutorials
section.para: This section contains a series of Flashlight tutorials. It is recommended that you go through these tutorials in order. It is also recommended that these tutorials be performed "hands-on" at your computer. You might want to create a new Eclipse workspace to use for these tutorials. In addition, if you run into any difficulties as you step through the tutorials please consider sending us a tip for improvement as described in .

figure.title: Menu item to install tutorial projects into your workspace

section.para: These tutorials assume that you have installed Flashlight. If you see a Flashlight menu item on your Eclipse main menu than you can assume it has been installed properly. To follow along with the tutorials you will also need to add the PlanetBaron project to your workspace. From the Eclipse main menu, choose FlashlightRun Flashlight Tutorials and add FlashlightTutorial_PlanetBaron to your workspace as displayed in and .

note.title: New Flashlight Launched Run Control Dialog
note.para: The Flashlight Launched Run Control dialog now lists each launched instrumented application. It lets you track the progress of the application from launch, through, collection, data preparation, to being ready to query in the Flashlight perspective. This dialog lets you stop data collection on a running process at any time. The use of this dialog is not fully described below but is straightforward to use. For example, prompts to prepare data no longer occur. When the run completes it is prepared. The dialog is discussed in the Android tutorial because it is critical to avoid having to Force Stop applications on the phone or tablet.
